intro: Sopubia duvigneaudiana, commonly known as the Duvigneaud's sopubia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to the high-altitude environments where it grows. Sopubia duvigneaudiana is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
